text: The list of Europeans by net worth is based on an annual assessment of wealth and assets compiled and published by Forbes magazine in 2019. In the same year the continent of Europe had over 500 billionaires (in USD). The countries with the most billionaires are: Germany (114), Russia (98), United Kingdom (54), France (41), Italy (35) and Switzerland (33). == Annual rankings == === 2019 === {| class="wikitable sortable" !Rank !Name !Net worth (USD): !Age !Country !Source(s) of wealth |- |1 |Bernard Arnaultt |76.0 billion |70 | |LVMH |- |2 |Amancio Ortega |62.7 billion |83 | |Zara |- |3 |Françoise Bettencourt Meyers |49.3 billion |65 | |L'Oréal |- |4 |Beate Heister & Karl Albrecht Jr. |36.1 billion |67/71 | |Aldi Sud |- |5 |François Pinault |29.7 billion |82 | |Kering |- |6 |Leonid Mikhelson |24.0 billion |63 | |Novatek |- |7 |Dieter Schwarz |22.6 billion |79 | |Schwarz Gruppe |- |8 |Giovanni Ferrero |22.4 billion |54 | |Ferrero SpA |- |9 |Vladimir Lisin |21.3 billion |63 | |Novolipetsk Steel |- |10 |Susanne Klatten |21.0 billion |57 | |BMW, Altana |- |11 |Vagit Alekperov |20.7 billion |68 | |Lukoil |- |12 |Alexei Mordashov |20.5 billion |53 | |Severstal |- |13 |Gennady Timchenko |20.1 billion |66 | |Volga Group |- |14 |Leonardo Del Vecchio |19.8 billion |84 | |Luxottica |- |15 |Dietrich Mateschitz |18.9 billion |75 | |Red Bull |- |16 |Vladimir Potanin |18.1 billion |58 | |Interros |- |17 |Stefan Quandt |17.5 billion |53 | |BMW |- |18 |Theo Albrecht Jr. |17.4 billion |68 | |Aldi Nord, Trader Joe's |- |19 |Hinduja brothers |16.9 billion | - | |Hinduja Group |- |20 |Stefan Persson |15.6 billion |71 | |H&M;
